byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting from Paris.

abstract: Arrest of puppeteers in Madrid under Spain's antiterrorism laws is just one of many prosecutions that have raised concerns over whether freedom of speech is under threat throughout country and elsewhere in Europe due to fear of terrorism; some European countries have had stricter laws governing political and hate speech than United States for decades, yet critics say way those laws are broadly being interpreted amid specter of Islamic extremism is troubling.
lead_paragraph: Spain’s arrests of two puppeteers are the latest in a string of prosecutions fueling a debate on whether freedom of speech is under threat in Europe.

headline.main: Crackdowns on Free Speech Rise Across a Europe Wary of Terror
headline.print_headline: Crackdowns on Free Speech Rise in a Europe Wary of Terror

snippet: Spain’s arrests of two puppeteers are the latest in a string of prosecutions fueling a debate on whether freedom of speech is under threat in Europe.
